description: Dive into "Architectural Wonders of Jaisalmer" ‚Äî a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Architectural Wonders of Jaisalmer

places.generalDescription: Jaisalmer Fort is a massive 12th-century fortified city with ornate Jain temples featuring idols and stone carvings. The fort, established by Rawal Jaisal, offers a glimpse into the history of the city.

sources.snippet: Here take a quick glance about Jaisalmer Fort Information from location, to timings, entry fee, architectural style, and many other things. Fort Palace Museum: 8 AM to 6 PM from April to October9 AM to 6 PM from November to MarchJain Temples: From 8 AM to 12 PM (Sambhavnath, Chandraprabhu, Rishabhdev)Other temples: From 11 AM to 12 PM. Also Read ‚Äì Hazarduari Palace History
sources.shortName: Jaisalmer Fort Rajasthan:- History, Facts, Architect, Travel Guide

sources.snippet: The magnificent Jaisalmer Fort, which rises majestically from the golden desert sands is one of the must-places to see in Jaisalmer. Unlike most forts, Jaisalmer Fort is used today, with the people living in the houses, some over 200 years old. It is an architectural masterpiece of Rajasthan and provides beautiful glimpse of the city and the desert at large.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best places to see in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan

sources.snippet: The Jaisalmer Fort also goes by the name Sonar Quila (Golden Fort) as it rises from the desert itself and seems to become one with the golden hues of the sand. The setting sun adds its own magic and shrouds the fort with mystique. The fort is constructed in the classic style of the royals by local craftsmen.
sources.shortName: Jaisalmer Tourism, Places to Visit in Jaisalmer, Fort Rajwada, Brys Fort

sources.snippet:
Address: Fort Road, near Gopa Chowk, Amar Sagar Pol, Jaisalmer Rajasthan-345001. Jaisalmer Fort:  Jailsalmer fort is one of the most important fort in Rajasthan India. The oldest fort built by Raja Jaisal in the year 1156 AD from
whom the fort got its name.
sources.shortName: Jaisalmer fort | History, Architecture, Timings, How to Reach|

sources.snippet: The fort is believed to have a rich history dating about 860 years back. For most of these years, the fort was actually the city of Jaisalmer. It was much later, in the 17th century, that people started settling on the outskirts of the fort's walls.
sources.shortName: Jaisalmer Fort- History, Timing, Architecture, Entry Fee, Major Attraction, Hotels

places.name: Jaisalmer Fort

reviews.text: A magnificent place meandering narrow streets packed full of history and intrigue. Lots of good views from outer walls. Cows walking through streets musicians playing in streets. Afterwards we went to outskirts of town to see sunset, although it was to right hand side of fort not behind it. Still worth it.

Wonderful fort also known as living fort. You can hire a guide if u want or you can explore it on your own. Take your time and explore slowly each and every part of the fort. You can see whole city from the top of the fort. Various small shops and markets are located around the fort prices are slightly higher than average but again you can bargain. Several eateries near the fort are a must try.

Wow it's a beautiful and crowded as well and with all the rushing we did manage to visit properly. Everything is great and profound history was amazing we did manage to see the prince on the occasion of his birthday and distributed sweets to people. I did see fighter jets of IAF flying over the fort.

places.address: Khejer Para, Manak Chowk, Amar Sagar Pol, Jaisalmer, Rajasthan 345001, India

places.generalDescription: When exploring the vibrant city of Jaisalmer in Rajasthan, a visit to the iconic Jaisalmer Fort is a must. This historical site offers a glimpse into the rich cultural heritage of the region. The fort stands as a testament to the city's cultural significance and is an essential stop for anyone seeking to immerse themselves in the authentic charm of Jaisalmer.

sources.snippet: Jaisalmer Fort is a place that attracts one in the heart of the city and has already been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. It‚Äôs a living fort with shops, hotels, and restaurants tucked within its walls. Just out of the city, the Sam Sand Dunes are breathtaking in their desert beauty, with camel rides and mesmerising sunsets.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Best places to visit in Jaisalmer

sources.snippet: Built by King Rawal Jaisal, the Jaisalmer Fort or the Sonar Quila shines with its golden sandstone walls. It depicts the route that joins India with Central Asia and the Middle East. The second-largest fort of Rajasthan, the Jaisalmer fort, stands 460m long and 230m wide with a 4.6m base.
sources.shortName: Architectural heritage of Jaisalmer :10 places for architects

sources.snippet: Imagine a city where golden sands meet golden architecture, where every structure whispers tales of a bygone era. That‚Äôs Jaisalmer for you. Nestled in the vast Thar Desert, this city is a vibrant tapestry of history, culture, and architectural brilliance.
sources.shortName: Jaisalmer's Architectural Wonders

places.generalDescription: Gadisar Lake, constructed in the 14th century by Rawal Gadsi Singh, is a man-made rainwater lake surrounded by small temples. It serves as a water source for the people of Jaisalmer and is known for its scenic tranquility. The lake attracts tourists and offers a peaceful retreat for architecture lovers, culture enthusiasts, and bird watchers.

sources.snippet: Gadisar Lake, located on the outskirts of Jaisalmer in Rajasthan, India, is a man-made reservoir that serves as a serene oasis in the arid Thar Desert. Built in the 14th century by Maharawal Gadsi Singh, the lake was created to fulfil the water needs of the town, but it has since evolved into a popular tourist attraction known for its stunning architecture and tranquil environment. The lake is adorned with intricately carved temples, ghats, and cenotaphs that reflect the rich cultural heritage of the region.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Best places to visit in Jaisalmer

sources.snippet: Laser Water Show at Gadisar Lake is one of the first and largest Laser Water Show having water screen projection mapping using 3-chip DLP projectors of 25,000 lumens. Show depicts story of founders of Jaisalmer city, Jaisalmer fort, attacks of invaders on the fort & sacrifice of brave Rajput to save their land, glimpses of other tourist locations in Jaisalmer region e.g. Tanot Mata Temple, Lodruva Temple, Laxminarayan Temple, Longowala war scenes, etc.
sources.shortName: Jaisalmer Tourism, Places to Visit in Jaisalmer, Fort Rajwada, Brys Fort

sources.snippet: The Gadisar Lake is an artificial lake constructed in the 14th century and is an ideal place to visit after avoiding the noise of the Jaisalmer city. Located amidst arched temples, steps to the water, and adorable yellow sandstone buildings, this lake is a perfect place for a visitor to come, sit back, and enjoy the scenery. It is a perfect place for taking a boat because of the scenic views and especially in the morning and evening.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best places to see in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan
Jaisalmer's Architectural Wonders

places.name: Gadisar Lake

reviews.text:
Gadisar Lake, Jaisalmer ‚Äì A Serene Oasis in the Golden City

Gadisar Lake, located on the outskirts of Jaisalmer, Rajasthan, is one of the most picturesque and historically significant attractions of the city. This artificial lake, originally built in the 14th century by Maharawal Gadsi Singh, was once the primary source of water for the arid region. Today, it stands as a beautiful blend of history, architecture, and natural beauty, drawing tourists from all over the world.

Scenic Beauty and Atmosphere

The first thing that strikes you about Gadisar Lake is its breathtaking beauty. Surrounded by stunning yellow sandstone temples, ghats, and intricately carved chhatris (cenotaphs), the lake offers a postcard-perfect view, especially during sunrise and sunset. The calm waters of the lake reflect the golden hues of Jaisalmer's architecture, creating a mesmerizing scene.

The lake is home to a variety of migratory birds, especially during the winter season. Bird watchers can spot species like cranes, pelicans, and kingfishers, making it a paradise for nature lovers. The gentle ripples in the water, combined with the chirping of birds and the occasional sound of temple bells, create a peaceful and soothing environment.

Boating Experience

One of the highlights of visiting Gadisar Lake is the boating experience. Paddle boats and rowboats are available, allowing visitors to explore the lake at a leisurely pace. As you glide across the water, you get an up-close view of the stunning structures that surround the lake. The reflections of the chhatris and temples in the water make for some truly amazing photo opportunities.

Boating is best enjoyed during the early morning or late evening when the weather is pleasant, and the golden light enhances the beauty of the surroundings. The experience is both relaxing and romantic, making it perfect for couples, families, and solo travelers alike.

Architectural Marvels and Temples

The lake is not just a scenic spot but also a place of historical and architectural significance. The Tilon Ki Pol, an elaborately carved sandstone gateway at the entrance of the lake, adds to its charm. According to legend, this gateway was built by a royal courtesan, Tilon, despite opposition from the ruling king. It is believed that she cleverly built a temple of Lord Krishna on top of the gate, ensuring that it would never be demolished.

Several small temples and shrines dedicated to Hindu deities line the lake's periphery, adding to its spiritual aura. The intricate carvings on the sandstone structures reflect the rich craftsmanship of Rajasthan and are a testament to Jaisalmer's glorious past.

Best Time to Visit

The best time to visit Gadisar Lake is during the winter months (October to March) when the weather is pleasant and ideal for sightseeing and boating. Summers in Jaisalmer can be extremely hot, making it difficult to enjoy outdoor activities. Early mornings and evenings are the best times to experience the lake's beauty, as the golden sunlight creates a magical effect on the water and surrounding architecture.

A peaceful and scenic spot in the heart of Jaisalmer! Gadisar Lake is perfect for a relaxing boat ride, especially during sunrise or sunset. Surrounded by beautifully carved temples and ghats, it's a great place for photography and quiet reflection. A must-visit for nature lovers and those looking to unwind away from the desert heat.
Place is beautiful but needs a little maintenance. Boat ride is enjoyable. I will Recommend morning time visit

places.generalDescription: Gadisar Lake in Jaisalmer is an artificial lake at the heart of the city, offering a serene escape and water-based activities like boating. Surrounding the lake are intricately carved temples, chattris, and ghats that enhance its charm. The entrance to the lake, made of yellow sandstone, is a sight to behold.

sources.shortName: The splendid architecture of Patwon ki Haveli in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan || One of the most opulent of the havelis in Jaisalmer

places.name: Gadisar Lake Jaisalmer

reviews.text:
Must added  in  your  Jaisalmer  tripüòç
This place is absolutely stunning-a true picture-perfect spot that feels like it belongs in a painting. The beauty of the lake is mesmerizing, especially as the sun sets, casting a golden glow across the water. The colors in the sky blend so effortlessly, making it a perfect backdrop for a peaceful evening. The surrounding area is filled with beautiful artwork, enhancing the natural beauty and creating a serene atmosphere. It's the ideal location to relax and soak in the views, with the artwork adding a unique touch that makes it even more special. Truly a place to spend quality time and appreciate both nature and art at their finest.

Must-Visit Spot in Jaisalmer: Gadisar Lake üåÖ‚ú®

Gadisar Lake (also known as Gadsisar Lake) is an absolute gem that should be on every traveler's Jaisalmer itinerary. Located just 1.5 km from the Jaisalmer Fort, this historic artificial reservoir dates back to 1156 AD, originally built by King Rawal Jaisal and later reconstructed by Gadsi Singh Bhati in 1367 AD.

From the moment you arrive, the serene beauty of the lake is captivating. As the sun begins to set, the golden light reflects off the water, creating a dreamy, picture-perfect scene that feels straight out of a painting. The sky transforms into a canvas of soft, blended hues-ideal for a peaceful evening stroll or capturing some stunning photographs.

Surrounding the lake are intricately carved temples, shrines, and cenotaphs (chhatris), showcasing the rich architectural heritage of Rajasthan. The atmosphere here blends natural beauty with artistic charm, making it a tranquil yet culturally enriching experience.

Things to Do:
Boating: Pedal and row boats are available, offering a calm ride across the lake. Prices range from ‚Çπ100 for a 2-seater pedal boat to ‚Çπ300 for a 6-seater rowboat.
Wildlife Watching: Spot catfish near the shore and enjoy watching migratory birds-perfect for nature lovers and photographers.
Sunset Views & Light Show: Arrive by 5 PM to find a good spot on the steps near the waterfront. Watch the mesmerizing sunset, followed by a light and sound show at 6:45 PM (entry included with fort ticket).
Street Food & Local Cuisine: Don't miss the vibrant food stalls nearby offering delicious and affordable local snacks. Also try the well-known 1156 AD multi-cuisine restaurant for a more relaxed dining experience.

Key Info:
Timings: Open daily from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM.
Entry Fee: No entry fee required. Parking is available (paid).
Facilities: Several shops at the entry point. However, washroom facilities were not visible, which could be improved.
Water Source: The lake is maintained through the Indira Gandhi Canal, ensuring it remains full year-round.

Final Thoughts:
While there is some room for improvement in terms of cleanliness, Gadisar Lake remains a must-visit. The combination of history, art, nature, and local flavor makes it a unique and unforgettable destination in the heart of Jaisalmer. Whether you're looking to relax, explore, or indulge in Rajasthani culture, this peaceful lakeside spot offers it all.

Highly recommended for an evening outing!

" Gadisar Lake " my most favorite lake üòç
The best timing Sun rise ‚ú®Ô∏è  &  sunset üåá
We can enjoy boating and night sound show here. Afreen Afreen Song's video (Nusrat Fateh Ali Khan) was recorded here.

Best month to visit -
November to February

Best Cafe & restaurant nearest Gadisar lake -
(1) Thatastu cafe jaislmer
(2) Cafe 1156 AD jaislmer

(3) 6 seat Rowing - Rs. 900 (half hour)
(4) 10 seat Rowing - Rs. 1500 (half hour)
(6) 2 seat Shikara- Rs. 600 (half hour )

Instructions for boating-
(1) 3 years above children are chargeable
(2) Over time will be extra charge
(3) must to wear safety jackets.

*** Don't forget to watch in the night-
Light & sound show at edge Gadisar lake

places.generalDescription: WelcomHeritage Mandir Palace is a stately palace hotel located in the heart of Jaisalmer, just a short walk from popular attractions like Jaisalmer Fort and Bhatia Market. Originally built for the royals in the 20th century, this historic hotel offers bright rooms and sophisticated suites with modern amenities. Guests can enjoy two restaurants, an outdoor pool, and onsite massages.

sources.snippet: The five-storeyed majesty of the Badal Mahal (Cloud Palace) is further enhanced by its pagoda-like Tazia Tower. Each floor of the palace has an intricately carved balcony. The Badal Palace owes its beauty to the skills of Muslim craftsmen who moulded the tower in the shape of a Tazia (a float that‚Äôs part of the procession of Muharram).
sources.shortName: Jaisalmer Tourism, Places to Visit in Jaisalmer, Fort Rajwada, Brys Fort

places.name: Hotel WelcomHeritage Mandir Palace

reviews.text: It's worth a stay if you want to get a taste of luxury in Rajasthan. The service is amazing and prompt. We stayed here only for a day and felt it was too less and could have spent more time. There is so much history and culture to know about

Palace is good. Nice pool facility. Good view of fort from terrace. But not great service & food. They reject for anything they ask in food. Just have damn less food options. No non veg available here. You need to order 1 day prior if u want. Spa is closed. Rooms are nice. You can't even ask for repeat juice in breakfast.

We visited the museum section  which is open for visitors at this site and there is an entrance fee for which you are allowed entry into one section of this palace which is converted into a museum which is maintained well by I assume is managed by the Hotel authorities managing this palace.  Well maintained and nice display of several items  used by the royal family.

places.address: Gandhi Chowk Rd, Sadar Bazar, Jaisalmer, Kishan Ghat, Rajasthan 345001, India

places.generalDescription: Patwon Ki Haveli, also known as Patwa Haveli, is a series of palaces from the early 1800s that have been transformed into a museum showcasing intricate carvings, furniture, and artwork. These grand havelis were built by wealthy Jain merchants during the 19th century and offer a glimpse into their lavish lifestyle.

sources.snippet: Patwon Ki Haveli is a group of five havelis which were constructed in the first half of the 19th century and is a fine example of the Rajasthani architectonic style. This magnificent building was built by a wealthy merchant named Guman Chand Patwa and features marvellous carving work and beautiful jharokhas (a sort of enclosed balcony). The havelis are famous for the exterior designing, the doorways and the mirror work done on the walls.
sources.shortName: The 7 Best places to see in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan

sources.snippet: Situated in Jaisalmer, in the state of Rajasthan, India, Patwon ki Haveli is considered one of the finest monuments admiring architecture. Constructed at the beginning of the nineteenth century, this fancy haveli was built by rich trader Guman Chand Patwa. The huge carvings and superb craftsmanship of this beautiful building express the rich cultural heritage of the whole area.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Best places to visit in Jaisalmer

sources.snippet: Patwon ki Haveli emerges from narrow streets with its windows, balconies, and intricate carvings to add grandeur to the architectural heritage of Jaisalmer. Besides being a cluster of five small Havelis, the complex is the largest one in the city. In addition to its wall paintings, balconies, gateways, arches, mirrors, and mural works highlight.
sources.shortName: Architectural heritage of Jaisalmer :10 places for architects

sources.snippet: Among the largest and the most elaborately carved havelis in Jaisalmer, this five-storey structure sits proudly in a narrow street. While the haveli has lost some of its early glory, a few paintings and mirror work art can still be seen on the inside walls.
sources.shortName: Jaisalmer Tourism, Places to Visit in Jaisalmer, Fort Rajwada, Brys Fort

sources.snippet: If you are on a tour of the havelis in Jaisalmer, you should visit the Patwon ki Haveli last. Because after seeing this haveli, your very definition of the word "haveli" will change. And after that, no other haveli will ever come up to your expectations.
sources.shortName: The splendid architecture of Patwon ki Haveli in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan || One of the most opulent of the havelis in Jaisalmer
Jaisalmer's Architectural Wonders

places.name: Kothari's Patwon Ki Haveli / Patwa Haveli

reviews.text:
A Fascinating Glimpse into Jaisalmer's Heritage!

Kothari's Patwon Ki Haveli is a must-visit when in Jaisalmer! This beautifully preserved haveli showcases the grandeur of Rajasthan's rich history and intricate craftsmanship. The detailed carvings, exquisite balconies, and stunning jharokhas reflect the architectural brilliance of the bygone era.

The museum inside provides insightful details about the merchant families who once lived here, along with displays of traditional artifacts and paintings. The view from the top is breathtaking, offering a panoramic sight of Jaisalmer's golden landscape.

A visit to this haveli feels like stepping back in time. If you love history and heritage, this place is definitely worth exploring !

Patwon Ki Haveli is absolutely breathtaking! The carvings on the walls and balconies are so detailed that you can spend hours just admiring the craftsmanship.

The entry fee is very minimal, and totally worth it. The best part for me was climbing up to the roof-you get an incredible view of the Jaisalmer Fort standing tall in the distance. It's one of those picture-perfect moments you'll want to capture.

The streets outside are buzzing with life, full of stalls selling colorful handicrafts and souvenirs.

Tip: Go a little early in the day before it gets too crowded, and don't miss the rooftop view!

A Fascinating Glimpse into Jaisalmer's Heritage! Kothari's Patwon Ki Haveli is a must-visit when in Jaisalmer! This beautifully preserved haveli showcases the grandeur of Rajasthan's rich history and intricate craftsmanship. The detailed carvings, exquisite balconies, and stunning jharokhas reflect the architectural brilliance of the bygone era.

Museum and Artifacts: The museum inside provides insightful details about the merchant families who once lived here, along with displays of traditional artifacts and paintings. The interiors hold a treasure trove of old letters, artifacts, and remnants from the British era, offering a rare glimpse into the lifestyle, trade practices, and social dynamics of that period.

Architecture and Craftsmanship: Built in the early 19th century by the wealthy Patwa family, this haveli is a testament to their immense wealth and influence. Each of the five havelis took around 12 years to complete and showcase unparalleled craftsmanship. Remarkably, these grand structures were built without cement or iron, relying solely on the ingenious rock-locking technique-a testament to the engineering brilliance of the time. The craftsmanship is simply stunning, with detailed facades, delicate balconies, and elaborate jali work.

Visitor Experience: A visit to this haveli feels like stepping back in time. If you love history and heritage, this place is definitely worth exploring. We got a guide who took us through the haveli, explaining everything. He charged us Rs. 50, but it was absolutely worth it. It took us about 20 minutes to explore the place. The view from the top is breathtaking, offering a panoramic sight of Jaisalmer's golden landscape. Tips for Visitors: Visit early in the morning or late afternoon to avoid crowds. Don't miss the rooftop view; it's absolutely worth it! A guide or audio tour enhances the experience significantly. Try not to go on public holidays or weekends as it's crowded and one may not enjoy taking photos. The market around the haveli offers good antiques and handcrafted items, though they can be a bit pricey.

Recommendation: Patwon Ki Haveli is a true architectural marvel in the heart of Jaisalmer. It's a must-see for anyone interested in architecture and history. The haveli's beautiful courtyards, finely carved windows, and stunning interiors make it a must-visit for anyone exploring the cultural legacy of Jaisalmer. Highly recommended!

Practical Information:
Entry Fee: ‚Çπ150 per person.
Guide Fee: ‚Çπ150.
Best Time to Visit: Early morning or late afternoon to avoid the heat and enjoy the golden glow of the fort.
Duration: Approximately 1 hour. Washrooms: Not available.
Parking: Not available.

Enjoy your visit to this magnificent piece of history!

places.address: No. 3129, Opposite Choora Paada, Rajasthan 345001, India

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Jaisalmer, the Jawahar Niwas Palace is a stunning testament to royal heritage and architectural beauty. Built in 1899, this magnificent sandstone palace not only showcases intricate designs but also serves as a luxurious heritage hotel that blends historical charm with modern amenities. Visitors are often captivated by its ornate entrances‚ÄîGanesh Pol, Rang Pol, Bhoota Pol, and Hava Pol‚Äîwhich reflect exquisite craftsmanship.

sources.snippet: This palatial haveli has served royalties from British Viceroys to Bollywood actors. Designed by a British architect and local craftsmen, Jawahar Niwas Palace was envisioned as a ‚Äòjewel in the crown‚Äô and was used as a colonial guesthouse. Today, the untidy residence is a heritage hotel run by the 43rd ruler of Jaisalmer, Maharawal Brijraj Singh.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Marvelous Havelis in Jaisalmer

reviews.text:
Sri Naminath Jain Temple in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan.

Address :
Shri Naminath Bhagwan Jain Mandir, Sadar Bazar, Jaisalmer 345001.

Mulnayak 21st Tirthsnkar Sri Sri Naminath Bhagwan, brown color in padmasana posture with beautiful parikar back side.

Beautiful Architectural Swetamber Jain Temple in the center of the city with beautiful carvings inside and outside walls. Temple is dedicated to Bhagwan Shri Naminath ji. Very well maintained peaceful temple. All facilities available for darshan-puja.

How to reach :
Jaisalmer nicknamed "The Golden city", is a city and district hqrs of Jaisalmer district of Rajasthan. The town lies in the heart of the Thar Desert (the Great Indian Desert) and is also famous for Jaisalmer fort. It is well connected with roads.
Train: Jaisalmer Railway Station.
Air: Jaisalmer Airport.
Beautiful Architectural Temple in city center, Temple dedicated to God Shri Naminath ji
Moolnayak Naminathji - Light Brown color marble stone, padmasan.

places.address: WW97+FG4, Sadar Bazar, Jaisalmer, Kishan Ghat, Rajasthan 345001, India

places.generalDescription: Silk Route Art Gallery in Jaisalmer offers a glimpse into the city's historical significance as a key stop on the ancient Silk Route. The gallery showcases traditional Rajasthani art, including paintings, textiles, and sculptures that reflect the region's rich cultural heritage. Visitors can explore handmade products such as quilts, cushion covers, and wall hangings created by local artisans. These items not only represent the city's culture and traditions but also make for unique souvenirs.

sources.snippet: Silk Route Art Gallery in Jaisalmer is a captivating destination that showcases the rich cultural heritage and artistic craftsmanship of the region. Nestled in the heart of the golden city, the gallery features an exquisite collection of traditional Rajasthani art, including intricate paintings, vibrant textiles, and handcrafted sculptures. Visitors can immerse themselves in the local art scene, exploring works that reflect the stories and traditions of the desert community.
sources.shortName: Top 20 Best places to visit in Jaisalmer

sources.snippet: As the trade on silk route dwindled, so did the fortunes of the Patwas. And the havelis were abandoned and then slowly fell into disrepair. One of the havelis was bought over by another tradesman, Shri Jeevan Lal Kothari.
sources.shortName: The splendid architecture of Patwon ki Haveli in Jaisalmer, Rajasthan || One of the most opulent of the havelis in Jaisalmer

places.name: Silk Route Art Gallery

reviews.text: After a busy day shopping in the fort I was exhausted and empty handed, Paris and his older brother deelp welcomed me with the best chai and a comfy seet, after a good chat and and awesome history lesson about the trading routs of rajathsan, they let me spend my time looking at everything pressure free.  I bought two awesome blankets and two door hangers that I will treasure for life, I'm even more happy that my money is going to a beautiful family that has been in the business for generations. Thankyou guys for everything, your amazing ‚ô•Ô∏è

I would like to turn the attention of everybody interested in textiles to this beautiful shop right next to the Jaisalmer Fort Palace Museum.
They stock an incredible selection of both historical and new textiles that will make the heart of any textile lover beat faster.
There is also a high level of expertise in a relaxed atmosphere, that's why I'm happy to have received this insider tip from friends.
Like me, you will be fascinated by the colours and impressed by the techniques of the very different textiles.
Have fun discovering and shopping!
Excellent collection of patchwork bed sheets,bed covers , traditional jackets and most important rates are very reasonable as compared to other stores

places.address: Dusshera Chowk,Near Maharaja Palace, inside Fort, Jaisalmer, Rajasthan 345001, India

places.generalDescription: Indira Gandhi Nehru Karyalya, formerly known as the DC Office, is a historic site that drew the interest of former Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. As a result of her efforts, the Rajasthan Government designated the Havelis within the complex as national heritage sites.

sources.snippet: The rest caught the attention of the then Prime Minister Indira Gandhi. She got the Rajasthan Government to grant the Havelis a national heritage status.

places.generalDescription: Nathmal Ki Haveli is a 19th-century privately owned mansion in Jaisalmer, known for its intricate exterior carvings and unique architecture. It was the former residence of Diwan Mohata Nathmal, the prime minister of Jaisalmer. Interestingly, it was designed by two Muslim jeweler brothers instead of traditional builders. Each brother constructed their respective side of the haveli to look similar but with subtle differences upon closer inspection.

sources.snippet: It is located in the heart of Jaisalmer, this haveli is was constructed by two Muslim brothers in the 19th century. And is highly appreciated for its marvelous architecture and intricate carvings. As one enters the Haveli, giant structures of two elephants ‚Äì made of yellow sandstone ‚Äì are likely to catch the visitor‚Äôs fancy.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Marvelous Havelis in Jaisalmer

sources.snippet: Two architect brothers built Nathmal Ji Ki Haveli in the 19th century. They worked on the haveli from two sides and the outcome is a beautiful blend of the symmetrical construction. Miniature style paintings and mighty tuskers carved out of yellow sandstone are used for decoration.
sources.shortName: Jaisalmer Tourism, Places to Visit in Jaisalmer, Fort Rajwada, Brys Fort

places.name: Nathmal Ki Haveli

reviews.text: It is not open to tourist. Family lives  there. We can only enter and see middle passage. Local items shop is established in that passage. That family allows only foreigner tourist to see their haveli.  Stone carvings are beautiful in this Haveli. You can skip this place if you have paucity of time. Photographs and video added along with this review.

Jaisalmer is known for beautiful havelis. This beautiful haveli is located in the heart of town in small lanes. It was built in 19th century by two brothers Nathmal and Hathi Singh. It is made up of yellow sandstone in true Rajasthani style. The beautiful carvings all over the buildings are worth seeing. It's a beautiful piece of architecture. It is not open to tourist. Family lives  there. We can only enter and see middle passage. Local items shop is established in that passage. That family allows only foreigner tourist to see their haveli.  Stone carvings are beautiful in this Haveli. You can skip this place if you have paucity of time. Photographs and video added along with this review.

Jaisalmer is known for beautiful havelis. This beautiful haveli is located in the heart of town in small lanes. It was built in 19th century by two brothers Nathmal and Hathi Singh. It is made up of yellow sandstone in true Rajasthani style. The beautiful carvings all over the buildings are worth seeing. It's a beautiful piece of architecture. it's open from 8 AM to 7 PM and entry is free.

places.address: WW87+938, Sadar Bazar, Jaisalmer, Rajasthan 345001, India

sources.snippet: There is a Sunset Point in Jaisalmer, from which you can experience a dramatic sunset on a day when the sky remains clear. There is also the Jaisalmer fort, made of sandstone, and resembling gold in glittering sunlight.
sources.shortName: How To Reach, Best Time & Tips

places.name: Sunset Point

reviews.text: This location is beside the Kaku cafe from where you can see the Golden fort and the sunset clearly. The last rays of the sun falls on the fort and turns it into the golden colour. You can also see the streets of the city get lit up as soon as the sun sets. You should visit the place before sunset as there is a shortage of places to sit.
such an amazing city view. Shanti se betha. Acha lga rha tha ankho ko nazara. Historical Place Aee really a amazing palace for visiting and some space for life.
